title: The Week India - 3 January 2016 (gnv64)
description:
The Week India - 3 January 2016
English | 84 pages | PDF | 23.9 mb

34 COVER STORY: As president of the Delhi and District Cricket Association, Arun Jaitley stayed clear of controversies and fought off the association's critics. His defence of the DDCA has backfired and his credentials as an administrator are under the scanner now. While Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal ordered a probe into the affairs of the DDCA, the BJP suspended Kirti Azad to protect Jaitley. The battle royale begins now.
The pitched battle between the BJP and the AAP does not bode well for Delhi
18 Current events: As the CBI looks to wrap up its probe into the Saradha scam before the state elections, Mamata cries political vendetta
22 Special report: For people living on the Line of Control in Kashmir, death is a constant companion
50 Society: With the closure of the Sirpur Paper Mill imminent, anger against the Telangana government overflows
54 Business: Turning SpiceJet around means a lot more than a business achievement
56 Banking: Government seems uninterested in the growth of Bharatiya Mahila Bank
58 Photo-feature: A school for children undergoing cancer treatment is making a difference
67 @leisure: The story of a unique golf club founded by a bunch of 'addicts'
